snippet: Annuities — which produce regular, guaranteed retirement income — still have their uses, but may come with hard-to-understand contract riders and high fees.
abstract: Financial services trade group Limra finds that variable and indexed annuities accounted for more than 80.8 percent of the annuities sold in the three years through 2013; although financial advisers consider these vehicles suitable for certain investors in certain circumstances, some contend that variable annuities and especially indexed annuities offer most buyers a poor deal--even if they can figure out what the deal entails.
lead_paragraph: Annuities — which produce regular, guaranteed retirement income — still have their uses, but may come with hard-to-understand contract riders and high fees.

headline.main: Annuities Not for Everyone, but They Have a Place
